title: Bitcoin Tops $20,000 for First Time
sub_head: The milestone is the latest bullish sign for cryptocurrencies
body:
Bitcoin surged above $20,000 on Wednesday for the first time in its 12-year history, part of a furious rally that has seen the digital currency nearly triple this year.
The digital currency was most recently up 6.7% at $20,734 after hitting a high of $20,885, according to CoinDesk.
The move above $20,000 is the latest bullish sign for cryptocurrencies, which after years of operating in the fringe are beginning to be taken more seriously by professional investors.
A string of well-known investors and companies have publicly unveiled bitcoin holdings this year, including hedge-fund managers Paul Tudor Jones and Stanley Druckenmiller, insurance giant MassMutual and other companies including Square Inc. and MicroStrategy Inc.
The record came after the U.K. investment firm Ruffer Investment Management disclosed that it was holding about $744 million of bitcoin.
